title: [BUG] iOS physical device crash with System.DllNotFoundException when using Enterprise Certificate Signing Identity
body:
**Description**

I am able to build and run my project fine when I run with my Apple Developer Account.  However, when I use my Enterprise Distribution Profile to sign, I receive a runtime exception on first access to SkiaSharp libraries. 

Exactly like this issue, except that it occurs with Enterprise Certificate instead of Developer Certificate:
[https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1129](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1129)

**Code**

*First access of Skia Sharp

**Expected Behavior**

Page should display normally.

**Actual Behavior**

iOS app Crash on exception: Dll Not found Exception.
Symptoms and error similar to 
[https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1129](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1129)

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.1.1
- Last known good version:  Did not work in 1.68 either. 
- IDE:  Visual Studio for Mac 8.5.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  13.4 
  - macOS:  10.15.3
- Target Devices:   
  - iPhone X
  - iPhone 11
  - iPhone 7
  - iPhone 8 
iOS versions 13.3.x - 13.4.1, 13.4.5 beta

** Discussion ** 
We have another developer workstation that can deploy a version that does not crash from the exact same code base to the same devices.  I have been unable to figure out what it is about this Mac that causes this issue.  I have tried removing certs from Keychain and adding again, reinstalling Provisioning Profiles, upgrading XCode and Visual Studio.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Did you ever manage to resolve this? Was it the certificates/keychain?

comments.author: glintpursuit
comments.body:
@mattleibow 

I am facing kind of same issue, on clean & then debug build app will works fine for 1 time only. 

I will need to clean the application every time before build & run.  (only for iOS)

So overall time for build has increased, as I can't take benefit of incremental builds. 

```
System.DLLNotFoundException
@rpath/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp
```

Source :   at SkiaSharp.SKAbstractManagedStream..cctor () [0x00105] in <2bf291170b6845129c51659902bb35f7>:0 

Dev Environment : Visual Studio For Mac 8.6.5 (Build 23), running on actual device iPhone X

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I would suggest opening an issue in https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios

It sounds like a bit there since normal accounts work.

comments.author: avorobjovs
comments.body:
I have the same issue on iOS 14.2

An error occurred: '@rpath/libSkiaSharp.framework/libSkiaSharp assembly:<unknown assembly> type:<unknown type> member:(null)'. Callstack: '  at (wrapper managed-to-native) SkiaSharp.SkiaApi.sk_picture_recorder_new()
  at SkiaSharp.SKPictureRecorder..ctor () <0x1178d9a28 + 0x00002> in <659007ac60e94125a4c9f512b9669a79>:0
